title: Pak-Tajikistan joint exercise concludes - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
RAWALPINDI: The six-day Pakistan-Tajikistan Joint Counter-Terrorism Exercise Dosti-ll concluded on Saturday at Fakhrobod Base, Tajikistan.

The joint exercise was conducted from August 4 to 9, in which two combat teams from Light Commando Battalion of the Pakistan Army and four combat teams from the Tajikistan Special Forces participated, according to a news release by the ISPR.

Besides harnessing the historic military-to-military relations between the two friendly countries, Dosti-II Exercise was aimed at refining drills, procedures and techniques involved in counter-terrorism operations through joint training. All training and military diplomacy objectives were achieved successfully.

Defence Attach√© (Pakistan) to Tajikistan, Colonel Muhammad Muazzam Zafar, graced the closing ceremony as Chief Guest from Pakistan side, while senior military officials from Tajikistan were also present.

Published in Dawn, August 10th, 2025
